About Me

Let me tell you a little about myself and what I do...

Your Project Is In Safe Hands

Hi, I’m Reza — a passionate game developer and PhD candidate in Biomedical Engineering at Isfahan University of Medical Sciences. I lead the Game and Treatment Lab, where we explore the intersection of interactive technology, neuroscience, and therapy.

With a strong foundation in signal processing and pattern recognition, I’ve naturally expanded into machine learning and deep learning, applying these techniques in both academic research and real-world development. You can check out my recent publications on my Google Scholar.

I thrive on solving complex problems, pushing creative boundaries, and constantly learning new technologies. This curiosity led me to master not only game engines like Unity and Unreal Engine, but also dive into full-stack web development to bring my ideas to life.

Whether it's building therapeutic games, developing AI models, or designing interactive web platforms, I’m driven by a desire to make meaningful and innovative contributions.

Visit the Work section to explore my latest projects and creative experiments. If you have a project idea or just want to connect, feel free to reach out — I’d love to hear from you!
